column2: Alaxel, or Prince, is an honorary title reserved for members of the ruling dynasty.
The Ajq'ij, or "calender keeper", is a distinguished priest attached to the royal court, responsible for the tracking of sacred days and the holy Long Count calender.
The Ajq'ojom is the royal drummer or town crier giving official announcements and enacting sacred plays or performances with his drumming.
An Ajtz'ib is a scribe or court writer, in charge of writing important court documents and minor calender keeping duties..
A Kamal Be is an honored elder responsible for the advising of the ruler and the managmenet and appointment of minor court officers.
The Yakal Ja, or "raiser of stone" is a court official who manages and administrates the palace building and the construction of sacred monuments.
The Q'atol, is the chief judge attached to the court, presiding over the courts of justice and law enforcmenent officals.
The Tupilies are constables under the direction of the Q'atol that are responsible for upholding laws throughout the realm.
The Ahau K'atun are the four "Cardinal generals" of the Kingdom of the Yucatan, each associated with a cardinal direction.
The Achi'l are the boon companions or sworn bodyguards to a Maya ruler.
